pinyin: jie1 shou1 qi4 ling2 min3 du4

sentences.english: We update sensitivities matrix by the quasi-Newton method after the first inversion.
sentences.chinese: 在第一次反演之後，採用擬牛頓法更新靈敏度矩陣。

sentences.english: For the speaker, the sensitivity at 1KHz and average sensitivity should be tested.
sentences.chinese: 測試耳機在1K赫茲時的靈敏度和平均靈敏度。

sentences.english: For the speaker, the sensitivity at 1KHz and average sensitivity should be tested.
sentences.chinese: 測試耳機在1K赫茲時的靈敏度和平均靈敏度。

sentences.english: The radiation response of 375 ℃ thermoluminescence(TL) peak can be changed.
sentences.chinese: 石英375℃熱釋光峯存在靈敏度的變化。

sentences.english: Series piezoelectric crystal sensor could detect this change sensitively.
sentences.chinese: 串聯式壓電傳感器可以靈敏地檢測到這種變化。

sentences.english: In Chapter 6, we study higher-order sensitivity in vector optimization problem.
sentences.chinese: 在第六章裏，討論的是向量優化問題的高階靈敏性。
這臺望遠鏡擁有三臺高靈敏度的紅外照相機。

sentences.english: Interviewers are like dogs; they can smell my fear.
sentences.chinese: 面試官像狗一樣能很靈敏的嗅到我的恐懼。

sentences.english: The snake sensitive resistance is sensitiver to pressure.
sentences.chinese: 爲增大靈敏度，設計了一種折彎形的壓敏電阻。

sentences.english: Either of the two typen is clever.
sentences.chinese: 兩個男孩中有一個很靈敏。

sentences.english: Apes and monkeys also have opposable thumbs on their feet that help their dexterity.
sentences.chinese: 類人猿和猴子腳部也有增加其靈敏性的對生拇指。

sentences.english: Our senses are more acute. We are more open to new experiences.
sentences.chinese: 感官變得更靈敏，更樂於接受新體驗。

sentences.english: Conclusion This method is simple, accurate, sensitive, and can be used to identify Jinniukou and similar species.
sentences.chinese: 結論本法簡便準確靈敏，可用於鑑別金鈕釦及類同品。

sentences.english: Serum RBP was a sensitive index in judging acute and chronic liver injury.
sentences.chinese: 提示血清RBP可作爲判斷急性肝損害的靈敏指標。

sentences.english: Be swift to hear slow to speak.
The results from these studies illustrate the high sensitivity of the instrument and its ability to generate reproducible binding responses.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明了儀器的高靈敏度和鍵合響應的重現性。

definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to have perfect mastery of sth/to be up to the mark
